required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Isotretinoin on CYP2D6 Activity
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Isotretinoin on CYP2D6 Activity

collaborator.agency: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)

brief_summary.textblock: Specific Aim: To investigate if isotretinoin (13-cis-retinoic acid) administration decreases CYP2D6 activity in adolescent patients.

detailed_description.textblock: In this aim, we will conduct a drug-drug interaction study evaluating the effects of 13-cis-retinoic acid on non-induced CYP2D6 activity in adolescent patients. Secondary analysis will evaluate the relationship between retinoid concentrations and CYP2D6 activity in these special populations

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, pre-post drug interaction study evaluating an approved drug (Phase 4) with a Phase 1 study design.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-pregnant
- ≥ 12 years
- Patients with severe acne that are expected to receive isotretinoin for therapeutic reasons
Exclusion Criteria:
- Weight < 80 lbs
- Allergy or adverse reaction to dextromethorphan, vitamin A or isotretinoin
- Pregnant or planning to become pregnant
- Unable to follow isotretinoin risk evaluation and mitigation strategies (REMS) program (also known as iPLEDGE program)
- Chronic or persistent cough accompanying asthma, smoking or COPD,
- Productive cough,
- Fever,
- Known kidney disease,
- Known liver disease,
- Diabetes
- Obesity, BMI ≥ 30 kg/m2
- Bipolar disease,
- Attention deficit disorder,
- Social phobia,
- Concurrent or use within 14 days of drugs known to interact with DM or CYP2D6 or drugs known to increase the risk of adverse effects from DM
- Concurrent use of any other product containing dextromethorphan
- Consuming foods, beverages or dietary supplements known to interact with DM or CYP2D6
- Unable to give written informed consent/assent,
- Inability to fast for 4 hours prior to study.
- Wards of the State

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor of Pharmacy, Adjunct Professor of Obstetrics and Gynecology

patient_data.ipd_description: After completion of the study, we plan to follow NIGMS/NIH and University of Washington requirements for data sharing.
